result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur L Clements was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arthur L Clements

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered found within the Plea Questionnaire.

9:32 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Arthur L Clements in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Arthur L Clements. 

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 1.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.


Court orders the following:
	
Fine:  $578.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  To be paid in 90 days. Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

HOW TO PAY:
Payments can be made on-line with a MasterCard or electronic check at:  http://wcca.wicourts.gov  (Read the agreement, then click "I agree," then click "Pay fees on-line.")  OR you may contact the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts Business Center at 262-548-7497.
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Shoe Carnival/Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

08:21 AM Defendant Arthur L Clements appeared by Zoom with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Request to appear by zoom
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 08-03-2022. "Granted"
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
